job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Ithaca, NY
cons: N/a the low pay rate is made up for from these lovely people that live here

review_title: Strongly dependent on the department you are in
job_title: Kitchen Staff in Medford Lakes, NJ
pros: Residents of the community are very accepting of other people and cultures. Based on Quaker values. Easy to stay on payroll for student holiday breaks. Community heavily emphasizes nature.
cons: Hit or miss with management, at least in the kitchen. Gossip and badmouthing is a sport that several managers partake in, out in the open. People who have been there a long time behave as if the rules do not apply to them, and indeed it appears they don't.

pros: short flexible shifts for high school students
Great coworkers, great environment, also nice residents
cons: Short shifts, somewhat low pay, can be a little messy

job_title: Dining Room Server in Medford, NJ
pros: Good job for high school and college students who have busy schedules
cons: None that I can think of

pros: Great way to learn how to serve, easy hours, good pay

review_title: I have worked in sanitation, dining health, and production.
pros:
Very flexible schedule and will work with you to make sure you get what ever you need. Management is very approachable and laid back. 
People in the kitchen are great and very fun to work with. Great for somebody who is in school and needs a better then average paying job.
cons:
No room to advance. 
Raises are terrible(my last one was about 22 cents. I've had ones as low as 10 cents) 
You can work so hard five days a week and be unnoticed, but one minor issue blows up like fireworks. 
Management does not care about people wanting to advance their career with their company.

They also seem to show a lot of favoritism. I was declined a job recently that I had went back and applied for( mind you I had 3+ years experience more then the person who got the position) and was told they really didn't see me doing that because "I'm a cook at heart". Total crap, I was fully aware of what I was applying for and 110% capable of what the job asked of me and they knew it.

job_title: Dining Services in Mount Laurel, NJ
pros: Supportive managers on duty, good if you're in high school, and flexible schedule. I enjoy my job and I have advanced and have been an educator for new comers. I am glad my bosses see my potential even when I have bad days. I get help when I need it and would help anyone else in need.
cons: Catty environment when working with the high school students.  I am more mature than they are not to mention older, so working with the younger crowd can be annoying in the least. Another thing many people during the day time call out and most kids have gone back to school and makes things much more complicated.

review_title: Great place to work for those interested in going to college!
pros:
- Medford Leas CCRC boasts an incredible employee retention rate, with many employees having served 10-20 years.
- A very caring retirement community with a VERY inviting and friendly atmosphere, Medford Leas definitely shows you love as an employee there.
- Management is typically quite understanding with the needs of its employees whenever it comes to time off.
- Scholarship opportunities for those interested in furthering their careers.
cons:
- Overstaffed.
- Insurance with no prescription drug plan.  Employees are encouraged to use the in-house pharmacy and hope that its hours are convenient enough.
- No opportunity to "cash out" PTO balances after they've reached their cap.
- Quite flawed evaluation system.

pros: Decent pay for full time workers. The residents are very welcoming and generally polite. Adequate training is typically given.
cons: Benefits cost more every year, and raises are typically minimal across the board, with high performers typically earning a 3% raise. Increases in per diem hires make staff shift around a lot, which makes the residents receive poorer care than in previous years (trust me, they complain about it). Recognition is also poorly managed.

review_title: Great benefit package, but you get worked hard
pros: dental, health, eye, free gym membership, free pool membership, discounted food, free personal trainers, amazing vacation time accrual, wonderful fellow staff and residents to work with.
cons: not enough staffing, no set schedule, average pay, no overtime allowed, high demand from management, (downsizing of staff, making positions do multiple positions work) work holidays, early mornings, and night shifts.

review_title: Had a very pleasant work experience
pros: Friendly co-workers, busy environment most of the time, felt like working with a very caring patient centered team, clean gym and work area too
cons: The actual facility where we were subcontracted with had a lot of issues which made almost every day very challenging, the sub acute units were very poorly managed

review_title: Things have been going down hill
pros:
Flexible with school
Above minimum wage
Most residents are delightful
cons:
Shortage of simple supplies such as rags, dishes, napkins, ect
Facility doesn't seem big enough for what it needs to accomplish 
Poor communication between depts and staff in general
Very poor planning in new kitchen areas

review_title: Medford Leas is an okay place to work.
cons: The management needs improvement.  The middle management are not properly educated on 'How' to manage.  They are treating the facility as a candy store (supplemental income).

pros: Decent payed time off, sick time is part of it
cons: As a bus driver you are re required to load and unloaded residents groceries, this can be very difficult when you have 18 passengers with an average of 5 bags apiece.do the math ,plus loading and unloading walkers.

pros:

cons:
